before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bh1fc","text":"To better preserve mRNA, make sure all equipment and lab surfaces are cleaned properly to prevent RNAse contamination (e.g., RNAse away, Thermo Scientific 21-402-178).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ab2go","text":"We report a single-step optical clearing method that is compatible with RNA fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) imaging. We previously demonstrated microscopy imaging with immunohistochemistry and genetic reporters using a technique called lipid-preserving refractive index matching for prolonged imaging depth (LIMPID). Our protocol reliably produces high-resolution 3D images with minimal aberrations using high magnification objectives, captures large field-of-view images of whole-mount tissues, and supports co-labeling with antibody and FISH probes. We also custom-designed FISH probes for quail embryos, demonstrating the ease of fabricating probes for use with less common animal models. Furthermore, we show high-quality 3D images using a conventional fluorescence microscope, without using more advanced depth sectioning instruments such as confocal or light-sheet microscopy. For broader adoption, we simplified and optimized 3D-LIMPID-FISH to minimize the barrier to entry, and we provide a detailed protocol to aid users with navigating the thick and thin of 3D microscopy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: HCR hybridization and amplification for large samples with cavities
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22nln","text":"Stain in antibody staining solution following manufacturer’s suggested incubation temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"74cam","text":"Remove as much fluids from the sample as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cb8b9","text":"It is recommended that no strong force is exerted on the sample during fluid aspiration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epgbr","text":"It is acceptable to leave some fluids and preserve the sample integrity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ds2h5","text":"Transfer LIMPID (H2O or SSC variant) to the sample-holding container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aadje","text":"The volume of added LIMPID is recommended to be at least 3 times the volume of the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avr5f","text":"Mix the solution by placing the sample container on a rotator or shaker for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1p4b8","text":"Remove LIMPID and transfer fresh LIMPID to the sample container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aa98c","text":"Mix the solution by placing the sample container on a rotator or shaker for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eevdt","text":"Examine the sample and its transparency","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"53iou","text":"It is expected that a thick sample is not completely cleared.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fif27","text":"Samples with chromophores (e.g., blood) will be tinted with the color. If needed, please refer to sample bleaching section above to bleach the sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dlvb","text":"Samples with some visible opaqueness can still generate good optically sectioned 3D volumes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hi1k","text":"If more clearing is desired, remove the LIMPID and transfer fresh LIMPID to the sample container. Incubate for 15 minutes on a rotator or shaker. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1eo59","text":"Examine the sample and its transparency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rnmo","text":"If more clearing is desired, remove the LIMPID and transfer fresh LIMPID to the sample container. Incubate for 30 minutes on a rotator or shaker at  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":148,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"36","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9n6p","text":"Further incubation can increase transparency of the tissue but with diminishing returns. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et4gj","text":"The transparency is expected to max out at 1 hour incubation at  . This can vary greatly depending on the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"al7h8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"36","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62rpp","text":"Note that long incubation may lead to probe leakage especially when not using SSC-LIMPID.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bssm","text":"Transfer the sample to a chambered tissue slide. A metal slide (Supplementary Fig. 6 a, method) was used for our samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6efvo","text":"Add LIMPID to slightly overfill the chamber (Supplementary Fig. 6 a).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3ir7r","text":"Place a coverslip on top of the chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cblg9","text":"Gently push the coverslip with a round tip tweezer or a tweezer with rubber tip to squeeze out excess LIMPID from the chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aks6j","text":"Gently remove excess LIMPID from the slide with a Kimwipe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56d1i","text":"Localized evaporation of LIMPID on the edge of the coverslip will create sealing of the chamber (Supplementary Fig. 6 b) that can easily be broken later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cg5bv","text":"Small magnets can be used to secure the coverslip (Supplementary Fig. 6 b).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cbing","text":"The sample is ready for imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
